Data: 6.30pm David Warner calls wrong. Sri Lanka have won the toss, will bat first. The crowd can get their 'Dilshan' placards ready. The bands will be out in full force. It should be a festive evening. Hopefully we have a wonderful game to round off what has been a superb series. Who would've thought we'd get the amount of cricket we have? Rains have stayed away and it's likely to stay that way again tonight
Starc to Perera, no run swing rightaway from Starc. Lands it full and wide outside off, moves away further. Kusal slashes and watches the ball skip past the outside edge on its way to Nevill
Starc to Perera, 1 wide Starc's radar is wonky, this time he slides down the leg side, past the flick. Wide
Starc to Perera, FOUR runs and Kusal sets to work with a crunching drive. Starc spears it too full and outside off, he rocks forward and strokes it to the right of Henriques at extra cover
Starc to Perera, 1 run Wade, at mid-off, dives to his right from mid-off and stops the ball. Overpitched and outside off, driven firmly again for one
Starc to Dilshan, 1 run pitched up and slanted across off, 149ks, Dilshan flashes a drive and skews an outside edge to third man
Starc to Perera, 2 runs dug in short on middle, Kusal keeps back and deflects it through square leg for a couple. Positive running
Starc to Perera, no run mighty full at off, almost a yorker, 149ks again, jabbed back to Starc
Hastings to Dilshan, no run he goes wide of the crease and delivers it wide outside off, Dilshan does not move his feet much. Throws his hands at it and flashes it to cover

Hastings to Dilshan, OUT Hastings spoils Dilshan's party! He walks off for the last time in international cricket. He raises his bat to the crowd and bows down near the edge of the boundary. He blows a kiss to the crowd as well. #ThankyouDilshan. This was a nothing delivery - short and wide outside off. Dilshan again slashes his hands at a cut. He can only bottom-edge it behind to Warner at first
Hastings to Dhananjaya, no run good length and angled in, defended
Hastings to Dhananjaya, no run inducker from Hastings, nips back in off the surface, and beats the inside edge
Hastings to Dhananjaya, 1 run short and angled into the right-hander, Dhanajaya shapes to pull and ends up dragging it to the leg side
Hastings to Perera, no run good length on middle, played back to the bowler
Starc to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs This fella has plenty of style! Starc bowls it full and outside off, hunts for awayswing, nothing here. Dhananjaya bends forward and caresses a drive through the covers
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run Starc hurls it outside off. angled away, at 149ks, drags his length back and beats the outside edge
Starc to Dhananjaya, 3 runs fullish and on off, chipped over mid-off for one. Wade hunts it down
Starc to Perera, no run dug in short and swerves back in at 145ks, beats Kusal on the inside and smacks the thigh pad
Starc to Perera, FOUR runs good length ball at the off stump, no lateral movement, Kusal sizes it up and launches it over midwicket with a pick-up shot. Right out of the Jayasuriya playbook
Starc to Perera, no run Starc bangs it short and outside off, forcing Kusal to leap back and clunk a cut to point

Hastings to Dhananjaya, 3 runs beau-ti-ful. Good length and outside off, Dhananjaya takes it on the up and drives it delightfully through extra cover. Three men chase the ball. Moises Henriques gets there first, dives near the edge of the boundary, and hauls the ball into the play of play. Good cricket all around
Hastings to Perera, 1 run back of a length and outside off, carved down to third man
Hastings to Dhananjaya, 1 run back of a length and angled in, he turns a single to midwicket
Hastings to Perera, no run shortish and outside off, bursts off the surface outside off and flies through to the keeper. Beats the batsman on the front-foot hook

Hastings to Perera, no run this is tapped straight to Faulkner at mid-off. Kusal takes a few paces forward and stops, Dhananjaya responds. Kusal nearly sold his partner down the river. Eventually, Dhananjaya is sent back. He makes it safely
Hastings to Perera, 1 run banged in short, Kusal gets on top of this, rolling his wrists and pulling to fine leg
Maxwell to Perera, FOUR runs Kusal welcomes Maxi with a reverse-sweep. Tossed up fullish on middle, he goes low and places it fine of short fine leg
Maxwell to Perera, 1 run this is pushed through outside off, he aims to reverse it again. This time he can only shovel it to short fine leg
Maxwell to Dhananjaya, 2 runs sliding across the right-hander, Dhana plays late and dabs it to third man. Nearly picked it off Neville's gloves

Maxwell to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs Dilshan is gone but Dhana is making the crowd groove to his tunes. Floated up outside off, he races down the track, meets the pitch, and drives it inside-out over extra cover
Maxwell to Dhananjaya, 1 run slides on quicker, driven to extra-cover for one
Maxwell to Perera, FOUR runs and the over ends the way it started. Pushed through on a straighter line, 95ks, Kusal reverses it, sweeping to the right of short third man
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, no run good length angled away, defended
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 1 run fraction short on off, swats a pull to deep square leg
Faulkner to Perera, no run Faulkner rolls his fingers across this cutter, leaves the left-hander outside off, and beats him in the channel. The opener played early and missed

Faulkner to Perera, OUT Warner tears to his right from mid-on and takes a great diving catch. For a moment, it seemed mid-off would collide with the captain, but Wade probably backed out of the way seeing Warner dash in. This wasn't the cutter, good length on middle, stopped a bit on Kusal. He attempts a leg-side flick and spoons a leading edge in the air. A prowling Warner latches onto the chance
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 1 run picked off through square leg
Faulkner to Chandimal, 1 run good length and outside off, leans into the drive and times it to Wade at mid-off
Zampa to Chandimal, 1 run full and drifts in on middle, nudged through square leg
Zampa to Dhananjaya, no run lobbed up on off, dabbed gently through point. There was a brief mix-up but they decide against the run
Zampa to Dhananjaya, 1 run tickled to short fine leg
Zampa to Chandimal, 1 run Zampa gives this loads of air on off, dips at the off stump, foils the attempted drive. Mis-hit down to long-on
Zampa to Dhananjaya, 1 run full on middle, Dhana drives it crisply down to long-on
Zampa to Chandimal, 1 run pitched up and outside off, laces a drive to long-off

Faulkner to Chandimal, OUT Chandi feebly chips a return catch! Not the cutter, seam-up from Faulkner, Chandi shimmies out and attempts a leg-side shot. He only manages a leading edge back to the bowler. Faulkner moves to his right and snaps it up
Faulkner to Mendis, 1 run banged in short on the stumps, pulled in the air to the left of deep midwicket

Faulkner to Dhananjaya, no run oooh! Maxi splatters the stumps at the striker's end from backward point. They got to the TV umpire. Replays show that Dhana is just home. Back of a length and angling away, dabbed with gentle hands to the left of backward point. Maxi swooped down on the ball, turned around quickly, and nailed a direct hit
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 1 run shapes to drive ends up jamming a drive down the ground
Faulkner to Mendis, no run too straight in line, flicked to midwicket
Faulkner to Mendis, no run Faulkner digs it a short ball, Mendis looks to hook but the ball bets big on him and defeats him
Zampa to Dhananjaya, 1 run too full on middle, backs away and drives it inside-out through cover
Zampa to Mendis, FOUR runs Mendis splits deep midwicket and deep square leg. He stretches forward to meet this full toss outside off, and sweeps it away to the boundary
Zampa to Mendis, no run Zampa drags his length back on off, chopped to cover
Zampa to Mendis, no run dropped shorter, pulled straight to Warner at midwicket

Zampa to Mendis, OUT Zampa roars an appeal for lbw, given by umpire Palliyaguruge. Did the pitch outside leg? Zampa held this back and found a bit of turn to rap the front pad as Mendis missed a sweep. The HawkEye shows that it pitched just outside leg
Zampa to Kapugedera, no run tossed outside off, pushed into the off side
Henriques to Dhananjaya, 1 leg bye heading into the pads, deflected behind square
Henriques to Kapugedera, 2 runs full and too straight in line, he glances it fine, the man in the deep, Starc, is squarer
Henriques to Kapugedera, no run length and outside off, patted to point
Henriques to Kapugedera, 1 run tight line just a shade outside off, tip-and-run single to point
Henriques to Dhananjaya, 1 run good length ball on off stump, angles a single down to third man
Henriques to Kapugedera, 1 run slightly back of a length on middle, shuffles across off and tucks it quietly through square leg
Zampa to Kapugedera, no run ample flight, dipping low full toss on the legs, flicked to midwicket
Zampa to Kapugedera, no run straighter one on off, good length, played back to Zampa
Zampa to Kapugedera, 1 run tosses another one outside off, slices a drive to sweeper cover. He wasn't close to the pitch as the ball dipped, creating distance between the bat and pitch
Zampa to Dhananjaya, 1 run another tossed-up legbreak outside off, Dhana seeks to loft a drive over cover, ends up slicing it straighter to long-off

Zampa to Kapugedera, 1 run Warner plunges into the action again, fires a direct hit at the non-striker's end, but Dhana was well in. Sri Lanka ultimately pinch a single off a ricochet as this was clipped towards Warner at midwicket
Zampa to Dhananjaya, 1 run uses his feet and drives down the ground for one
Henriques to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs straying into the pads, leg-side deflection fine for four. Minimalist touch
Henriques to Dhananjaya, 1 run full and outside off, this is tapped down to third man with an angled bat
Henriques to Kapugedera, 1 run full and straight, driven through midwicket
Henriques to Dhananjaya, no run back of a length and angled in, run away to backward point
Henriques to Dhananjaya, no run back of a length and outside off, cut late to backward point
Henriques to Dhananjaya, 1 run this one kicks up from a back of a length, tennis-ball bounce, surprises the batsman. Fended away towards the midwicket region
Zampa to Dhananjaya, 1 run lobbed up on middle, no turn, eases a drive to long-on

Zampa to Kapugedera, no run sharp turn for Zampa! An appeal for stumping, they refer it to the TV umpire. Lovely legbreak, drifted in and ripped away. Kapu is drawn forward for the leg-side flick, but grounds his back leg before Nevill swiped the bails off

Zampa to Kapugedera, OUT Warner in the thick of things in Colombo. This was the fast slider outside off, 96.2ks, shorter and outside off. Kapu wants to pull but ends up dragging the ball in the air. Waner throws himself to his left and completes a smart, low catch at midwicket
Zampa to Perera, no run pushed through on middle, defended back towards the bowler

Zampa to Perera, OUT Thisara now holes out, SL six down. Short legbreak on top of middle. Thisara takes it on with a pull. He has to settle with a miscue to deep square leg, where Head clings onto it. He exits for a duck
Zampa to Dhananjaya, 1 run Zampa flights this one on off, the length is full, knocked down to long-on. Quality spell from the wristspinner. 4-0-16-3
Henriques to Dhananjaya, 1 run full on middle, there's that debonair flick through midwicket
Henriques to Pathirana, 1 wide good length and outside off, climbs sharply outside off, Pathirana attempted a slash and missed, but the line was too wide outside off
Henriques to Pathirana, 1 run short and outside off, inside the tram-line, Pathirana gets on top of the bounce and rides it down to third man
Henriques to Dhananjaya, 1 run banged in short and outside off, sits up to be pulled. Rolls his wrists and controls it behind square on the leg side
Henriques to Pathirana, no run full and angled in, poked back to the bowler
Henriques to Pathirana, FOUR runs back of a length and outside off, Pathirana runs it away fine on the off side. Nevill dived to his left, the ball took his glove and ran away
Henriques to Pathirana, 1 run full and outside off, sliced off an outside edge wide of Maxwell

Hastings to Pathirana, OUT SL seven down and sinking Hastings returns and strikes. Banged in short on off, cramps Pathirana for room, who was on the front foot. He gets into a tangle. Pulls and splices a return catch
Hastings to Prasanna, 1 run dug short on middle, swivel-pulled to long leg
Hastings to Dhananjaya, 1 run Hastings goes wide of the crease and sends down a slower one outside off, the batsman waits and cuts to sweeper cover
Hastings to Prasanna, no run leaps back, gets on top of short one outside off and dabs it to backward point
Hastings to Prasanna, 1 run Hastings hammers a short ball on off, this time to the right-hander. He rocks back nimbly and pulls to fine leg
Hastings to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs thwacked to the left of mid-off for a boundary. In-between length outside off, Dhana had ample time to fiercely flat-bat it away
Faulkner to Prasanna, no run back of a length on off, played back to the bowler
Faulkner to Prasanna, no run back of a length and swerving away outside off, looks to pull, and the ball kisses the trouser pocket on its way to the keeper. Excellent call from umpire Martinesz
Faulkner to Prasanna, 1 run stroked to the covers for one
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 2 runs short on off, hops and tucks through square leg. Dhana wants two and gets it. Head was patrolling the boundary there

Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 2 runs picked off the pads through square leg again, sharp running between the pair again. Head throws it to the keeper who takes the bails off, but Dhana makes it with a dive, the TV umpire confirms it
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 1 run sliding into the hips, turned behind square on the leg side now, just a single
Starc to Dhananjaya, 1 wide he goes wide of the crease and angles a slower one down leg, 100 up for SL
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run hurled outside off from wide of the crease, Dhana reaches out with his hands, but can't carve it away
Starc to Dhananjaya, 1 run wide of the crease and angled into the right-hander, nurdles a single through mid-on
Starc to Prasanna, 1 run full toss outside off, stabbed to extra cover, diving stop from the fielder
Starc to Dhananjaya, 2 runs low full toss outside off, slices a drive square through the off side for a couple. Dhana is helming a sinking ship. He gets to his maiden T20I fifty
Starc to Dhananjaya, 1 run tip-and-run single towards point
Starc to Prasanna, 1 run rising short ball outside off, Prasana, hops, skips, and angles a single to backward point
Faulkner to Prasanna, 1 run back of a length on middle, jabbed out to midwicket
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs Dhana charges out at Faulkner. He pulls his length back on the stumps, slogs and sends a thick outside edge to third man
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 1 run you've gotta love his flicks. Pristine. Full and straight, hit to midwicket
Faulkner to Prasanna, 1 run short ball, skiddy on the leg stump, pulls and top-edges it over the square-leg umpire
Faulkner to Dhananjaya, 1 run back of a length, shuffles across and flicks through square leg

Faulkner to Prasanna, OUT Prasanna holes out to long-on. Full on middle, in the slot for Prasanna to put it away. He swings for the hills and ends up getting more height rather than distance. Khawaja settles under the skier
Hastings to Senanayake, 1 run full and angled in on middle, drop-and-run single to short midwicket. A direct hit could have dismissed Sena
Hastings to Dhananjaya, 2 runs Head rushes in from sweeper cover, but the ball dies in front of him. Short and wide outside off, looks like the cutter. Slashed in the air over the off side
Hastings to Dhananjaya, 1 run short and outside off, pulled to wide long-on
Hastings to Senanayake, 1 wide bouncer outside off, too high, balloons to the keeper. Wide. Tennis-ball loopy bounce, raises a puff of dust from the surface. One for the over, says the ump
Hastings to Senanayake, 1 run skiddy short ball outside off, leaps, gets on top of it and rides it down to third man
Hastings to Dhananjaya, 1 run dug in short on off, Dhana absolutely cracks a pull, but finds deep midwicket
Hastings to Senanayake, (no ball) another bumper, this is deemed a no-ball. Trampolines over a ducking batsman. Second of the over. Hastings isn't pleased with the call
Hastings to Senanayake, 1 run length and outside off, Sena hacks it down to long-on
Starc to Senanayake, 1 wide Starc ventures wide of the crease and angles another leg-side wide
Starc to Senanayake, no run full and straightens outside off from wide of the crease, Sena backs away, has an almighty swipe, but can't touch it
Starc to Senanayake, 1 run too full on off, he can't get under it. Squeezes a drive to long-on and turns the strike over to Dhana
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run bouncer outside off from wide of the crease, 140ks, Dhana slashes and connects only with thin air

Starc to Dhananjaya, OUT Starc in danger of going wicketless for the first time on the tour Full toss outside off, Dhana aims to pump it over the infield. He can only skew it off the bottom part of the bat. He got it over extra-cover, but mid-off tracked to his left and pouched it. Good catch from Faulkner
Starc to Senanayake, 2 runs full and straight, angled in, picked up and flicked over square leg
Starc to Senanayake, 1 run angled in full from wide of the crease, this is picked up over midwicket

8.30pm No fireworks from Dilshan in his farewell match, but Dhananjaya stroked his maiden T20I fifty to briefly rejuvenate Sri Lanka. On boy! those flicks were simply gorgeous. However, barring Dhana, only Kusal managed to move into double digits. Australia's bowers chipped away on a dry surface and were backed up by sharp fielding. They need 129 to clinch the series 2-0. We'll be back in 10 minutes.

Maxwell ignited the modest chase with a bevy of reverse-sweeps and switch-hits and scorched his way to an 18-ball half-century, the fastest by an Australian in T20 internationals. The tourists were cruising at 93 for 0, before Sri Lanka's spinners unravelled the chase, briefly tearing open the portal to the Test series. Head ultimately dragged his side past the line.

10.05pm That is that. End of Dilshan's 497th and last international match. Australia crash his farewell party. He, however, reaches out to the crowd, takes high-fives, and acknowledges the applause. He signs off with a wicket off his last delivery in international cricket. #ThankyouDilshan
He thanks his principals, coaches, captains, and SLC presidents in Sinhala.
Dilshan is honoured by the SLC under firework-filled skies.
10.25pm Hmm, the players are seated. A long presentation beckons.

The Sri Lankan players send-off Dilshan. He walks into the sunset and joins his old-mates Sanga and Mahela. Many thanks for tuning in. Time to bring the curains down on Australia's tour of Sri Lanka as well. Stay classy, good night!
10.45pm Warner collects the trophy and soaks in the moment with his team-mates. Andrew Fernando's report will tell you the full story of Dilshan's farewell match.
Dilshan to Khawaja, 1 run dragged down on off stump, goes back and pulls to deep backward
Dilshan to Wade, 1 run Wade now brings out the reverse sweep and sends the ball to backward point
Senanayake to Wade, 1 run skiddy full ball on middle, tickled into the pads as the ball rolls to midwicket
Senanayake to Head, 1 run slides on off, plays for the turn, and gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
Senanayake to Wade, 1 run Wade goes back, gets on top of this short ball on middle and cuts it to deep point
Senanayake to Head, no run tossed up liberally on middle, played back to the bowler
Senanayake to Head, no run Head skips out, does not meet the pitch, drags an inside edge to the leg side
Senanayake to Head, no run tossed on off, dabbed with an open face towards point
Dilshan to Wade, no run flatter and outside off, punched out to the covers
Dilshan to Wade, 3 runs Dilshan held this offbreak back, Wade skipped out and poked an outside edge wide of reach of backward point
Dilshan to Head, no run straight ball on off, tapped to cover
Dilshan to Head, 1 run short and spins away outside off, lashed down to long-off
Dilshan to Wade, no run slider on middle, chopped from there to cover
Pathirana to Head, 1 run back of a length and outside off, punched to long-on
Pathirana to Nevill, 3 runs tossed up full on middle, Nevill bends low and scoops it over the head of the keeper
Pathirana to Head, no run Head hunts for the gallery hit and nearly gives it away. He dances out for a muscular tug over midwicket, does not meet the pitch, and is struck on the pad
Pathirana to Head, no run Head shimmies out, Pathirana held it back on off. Quietly played back to the bowler

Pathirana to Head, SIX runs Palmed over for six. Australia sweep the series 2-0! Head dares to charge at Pathirana again. Mowed it to deep midwicket, where Sena leaps and only lobs it over the fence. Initially omitted from the ODI squad to face Sri Lanka in limited-overs matches, Head seals the chase with a slog-swept boundary

Maxwell ignited the modest chase with a bevy of reverse-sweeps and switch-hits and scorched his way to an 18-ball half-century, the fastest by an Australian in T20 internationals. The tourists were cruising at 93 for 0, before Sri Lanka's spinners unravelled the chase, briefly tearing open the portal to the Test series. Head ultimately dragged his side past the line.

10.05pm That is that. End of Dilshan's 497th and last international match. Australia crash his farewell party. He, however, reaches out to the crowd, takes high-fives, and acknowledges the applause. He signs off with a wicket off his last delivery in international cricket. #ThankyouDilshan
He thanks his principals, coaches, captains, and SLC presidents in Sinhala.
Dilshan is honoured by the SLC under firework-filled skies.
10.25pm Hmm, the players are seated. A long presentation beckons.

The Sri Lankan players send-off Dilshan. He walks into the sunset and joins his old-mates Sanga and Mahela. Many thanks for tuning in. Time to bring the curains down on Australia's tour of Sri Lanka as well. Stay classy, good night!
10.45pm Warner collects the trophy and soaks in the moment with his team-mates. Andrew Fernando's report will tell you the full story of Dilshan's farewell match.
Australia won by 4 wickets (with 13 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Glenn Maxwell, AUS
